name: Promoting Population Health through Increased Capacity in Alcohol Epidemiology
objective: The purpose of this program is to support the building of capacity in alcohol epidemiology in state and large city Health Departments and help provide the tools needed to perform core public health functions, such as public health surveillance.  This increased epidemiologic capacity will help build the public health infrastructure that is needed to address excessive alcohol use; the fourth leading preventable cause of death in the U.S.
top_agency_name: Department of Health and Human Services
sub_agency_name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
applicant_types: State (includes District of Columbia, public institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: Public Health Service Act, as amended, Section 301(a) and Section 317K, 42 U.S.C. 241(a); 42 U.S.C. 247b-12.

rules_regulations: Recipients must follow regulations specified by 45 CFR 75.
